--- title: "model" format: html editor: visual --- ::: {#a098f8e2 .cell execution_count=1} ``` {.python .cell-code} from palmerpenguins import penguins from pandas import get_dummies import numpy as np from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression from sklearn import preprocessing ``` ::: ::: {#14f16931 .cell execution_count=2} ``` {.python .cell-code} import duckdb from palmerpenguins import penguins con = duckdb.connect('my-db.duckdb') df = con.execute("SELECT * FROM penguins").fetchdf().dropna() df.head(3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=2} ```{=html}
species island bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm body_mass_g sex year

``` ::: ::: ::: {#ea82f49c .cell execution_count=3} ``` {.python .cell-code} X = get_dummies(df[['bill_length_mm', 'species', 'sex']], drop_first = True) y = df['body_mass_g'] model = LinearRegression().fit(X, y) ``` ::: ::: {#bd70df45 .cell execution_count=4} ``` {.python .cell-code} print(f"R^2 {model.score(X,y)}") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` R^2 0.8555368759537614 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#7bb92770 .cell execution_count=5} ``` {.python .cell-code} print(f"Intercept {model.intercept_}") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Intercept 2169.2697209393996 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#3968f44d .cell execution_count=6} ``` {.python .cell-code} print(f"Columns {X.columns}") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Columns Index(['bill_length_mm', 'species_Chinstrap', 'species_Gentoo', 'sex_male'], dtype='object') ``` ::: ::: ::: {#b6b44ed0 .cell execution_count=7} ``` {.python .cell-code} from vetiver import VetiverModel v = VetiverModel(model, model_name = 'penguin_model', prototype_data = X) ``` ::: ::: {#8867851d .cell execution_count=8} ``` {.python .cell-code} from pins import board_folder from vetiver import vetiver_pin_write b = board_folder('data/model', allow_pickle_read = True) vetiver_pin_write(b, v) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Model Cards provide a framework for transparent, responsible reporting. Use the vetiver `.qmd` Quarto template as a place to start, with vetiver.model_card() Writing pin: Name: 'penguin_model' Version: 20240424T054613Z-aa876 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#62bfc415 .cell execution_count=9} ``` {.python .cell-code} from vetiver import VetiverAPI app = VetiverAPI(v, check_prototype = True) ``` :::
